alert.note: Alert for La Crosse; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 2:43AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following locations along the Mississippi River in Wisconsin...Minnesota...Iowa... Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4 affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. Mississippi River at Lansing affecting Vernon, Allamakee, Houston and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Clayton and Grant Counties. Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Allamakee, Clayton and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting La Crosse, Houston and Vernon Counties. Mississippi River at Winona affecting Winona, Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. Mississippi River at Lake City affecting Wabasha, Pepin and Goodhue Counties. Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. .The crest on the Mississippi River has moved south of the area. While some precipitation will fall across the area through Monday, the amounts will be so light that they will not impact the slow fall that is occurring. The Mississippi River at Lake City MN will fall below flood stage on Wednesday and Lansing IA on Saturday. All other rivers will fall into either minor or moderate stage by the end of this week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at La Crosse. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, water is within one foot of Rose Street near Interstate 90. La Fond Street on French Island is closed. Water will encroach on Clinton Street. The shelter, playground, and ball parks in Copeland Park are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 AM CDT Sunday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 13.4 feet next Friday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water flow at these levels can be very dangerous. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning at 11 AM CDT.
